h1.a: Welcome to Blooming Grove Independent School District

div.div: Blooming Grove ISD serves PreK-12th grade students and is located in Blooming Grove, TX.

h1.a: LAST DAY to submit pictures and text for senior ads in yearbook

div.div: Location: Yearbook will not guarantee a published ad or offer a refund if this deadline is not met. Questions? Contact Ms. Coward at ccoward@bgrove.org

h1.a: BGISD At Home Learning and COVID-19 Resource Site

img.alt: BGISD At Home Learning and COVID-19 Resource Site Thumbnail Image

h1.a: Rick Hartley Named as Lone Finalist in Superintendent Search

img.alt: Rick Hartley Named as Lone Finalist in Superintendent Search Thumbnail Image

div.div: Monday, April 20, 2020 - Rick Hartley is excited about serving the community of Blooming Grove ISD. He comes to us after serving as Superintendent of Shepherd ISD and, previously, Assistant Superintendent in Waco ISD. Having been an educator for 32 years, he brings a passion for providing students opportunities to be more than they imagined. Mr. Hartley has been married to Barbara for 34 years. They have a daughter, son-in-law, and four wonderful grandchildren. His hobbies away from school are centered around reading, wood working, golf, and motorcycle rides. They enjoy small town living and are looking forward to becoming part of the community.

h1.a: FREE LUNCH: MONDAY AND WEDNESDAY DELIVERY BEGINNING MARCH 30TH.

img.alt: FREE LUNCH: MONDAY AND WEDNESDAY DELIVERY BEGINNING MARCH 30TH. Thumbnail Image

div.div:
Children will receive two meals on Monday and three meals on Wednesday. We will continue to deliver lunches during the Shelter In Place for Navarro County.
Here are the locations:

img.alt: BGISD CLOSURE EXTENDED THROUGH MAY 4, 2020 Thumbnail Image

div.div:
Currently, per Governor Abbott, Blooming Grove ISD is closed until Monday, May 4, 2020, to control the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19). We will continue to work with national, state and local health authorities to monitor this situation and evaluate our plans accordingly.
This is a difficult time for everyone in the country including the families, students and staff of our BGISD community. We appreciate your words of support and encouragement of our schools as we continue to make difficult decisions regarding this unprecedented situation. We will continue to update these resources on our website and social media.
Enjoy the video of one of the latest happenings at BGISD.
